channel.title: CVE Feed for Secomea -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Secomea -- all products

item.title: CVE-2020-14510|2024-08-04T12:46:34.680Z -- secomea -- gatemanager
item.description: GateManager versions prior to 9.2c, The affected product contains a hard-coded credential for telnet, allowing an unprivileged attacker to execute commands as root.

item.title: CVE-2020-29022|2024-08-04T16:48:01.436Z -- secomea -- gatemanager
item.description: Failure to Sanitize host header value on output in the GateManager Web server could allow an attacker to conduct web cache poisoning attacks. This issue affects Secomea GateManager all versions prior to 9.3

item.title: CVE-2020-29024|2024-08-04T16:48:01.408Z -- secomea -- gatemanager
item.description: Sensitive Cookie in HTTPS Session Without 'Secure' Attribute vulnerability in (GTA) GoToAppliance of Secomea GateManager could allow an attacker to gain access to sensitive cookies. This issue affects: Secomea GateManager all versions prior to 9.3.

item.title: CVE-2020-29025|2024-08-04T16:48:01.522Z -- secomea -- sitemanager%20embedded%20%28sm-e%29
item.description: A vulnerability in SiteManager-Embedded (SM-E) Web server which may allow attacker to construct a URL that if visited by another application user, will cause JavaScript code supplied by the attacker to execute within the user's browser in the context of that user's session with the application. This issue affects all versions and variants of SM-E prior to version 9.3

item.title: CVE-2020-29027|2024-08-04T16:48:00.931Z -- secomea -- sitemanager
item.description: Cross-site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability in GUI of Secomea SiteManager could allow an attacker to cause an XSS Attack. This issue affects: Secomea SiteManager all versions prior to 9.3.

item.title: CVE-2020-29032|2024-08-04T16:48:01.434Z -- secomea -- gatemanager
item.description: Upload of Code Without Integrity Check vulnerability in firmware archive of Secomea GateManager allows authenticated attacker to execute malicious code on server. This issue affects: Secomea GateManager all versions prior to 9.4.621054022

item.title: CVE-2020-14508|2024-08-04T12:46:34.703Z -- secomea -- gatemanager
item.description: GateManager versions prior to 9.2c, The affected product is vulnerable to an off-by-one error, which may allow an attacker to remotely execute arbitrary code or cause a denial-of-service condition.

item.title: CVE-2020-29026|2024-08-04T16:48:01.207Z -- secomea -- gatemanager
item.description: A directory traversal vulnerability exists in the file upload function of the GateManager that allows an authenticated attacker with administrative permissions to read and write arbitrary files in the Linux file system. This issue affects: GateManager all versions prior to 9.2c.

item.title: CVE-2020-29021|2024-08-04T16:48:01.411Z -- secomea -- gatemanager
item.description: A vulnerability in web UI input field of GateManager allows authenticated attacker to enter script tags that could cause XSS. This issue affects: GateManager all versions prior to 9.3.

item.title: CVE-2020-29030|2024-08-04T16:48:01.369Z -- secomea -- gatemanager
item.description: Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) vulnerability in web GUI of Secomea GateManager allows an attacker to execute malicious code. This issue affects: Secomea GateManager All versions prior to 9.4.

item.title: CVE-2020-29029|2024-08-04T16:48:01.576Z -- secomea -- gatemanager
item.description: Improper Input Validation, Cross-site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability in Web GUI of Secomea GateManager allows an attacker to execute arbitrary javascript code. This issue affects: Secomea GateManager all versions prior to 9.4.

item.title: CVE-2020-29023|2024-08-04T16:48:01.570Z -- secomea -- gatemanager
item.description: Improper Encoding or Escaping of Output from CSV Report Generator of Secomea GateManager allows an authenticated administrator to generate a CSV file that may run arbitrary commands on a victim's computer when opened in a spreadsheet program (like Excel). This issue affects: Secomea GateManager all versions prior to 9.3.

item.title: CVE-2020-29028|2024-08-04T16:48:01.757Z -- secomea -- gatemanager
item.description: Cross-site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability in web GUI of Secomea GateManager allows an attacker to inject arbitrary javascript code. This issue affects: Secomea GateManager all versions prior to 9.4.

item.title: CVE-2020-29031|2024-08-04T16:48:00.792Z -- secomea -- gatemanager
item.description: An Insecure Direct Object Reference vulnerability exists in the web UI of the GateManager which allows an authenticated attacker to reset the password of any user in its domain or any sub-domain, via escalation of privileges. This issue affects all GateManager versions prior to 9.2c

item.title: CVE-2020-29020|2024-08-04T16:48:00.791Z -- secomea -- sitemanager
item.description: Improper Access Control vulnerability in web service of Secomea SiteManager allows remote attacker to access the web UI from the internet using the configured credentials. This issue affects: Secomea SiteManager All versions prior to 9.4.620527004 on Hardware.

item.title: CVE-2020-14512|2024-08-04T12:46:34.682Z -- secomea -- gatemanager
item.description: GateManager versions prior to 9.2c, The affected product uses a weak hash type, which may allow an attacker to view user passwords.

item.title: CVE-2023-3675|2024-08-02T07:01:57.508Z -- secomea -- gatemanager
item.description: Improper Limitation of a Pathname to a Restricted Directory ('Path Traversal') vulnerability in Secomea GateManager (Web GUI) allows Reading Data from System Resources.This issue affects GateManager: from 11.0.623074018 before 11.0.623373051.

item.title: CVE-2024-1579|2024-08-01T18:40:21.431Z -- secomea -- gatemanager
item.description: Incorrect Usage of Seeds in Pseudo-Random Number Generator (PRNG) vulnerability in Secomea GateManager (Webserver modules) allows Session Hijacking.This issue affects GateManager: before 11.2.624071020.

item.title: CVE-2024-1969|2024-08-01T18:56:22.773Z -- secomea -- gatemanager
item.description: Buffer Copy without Checking Size of Input ('Classic Buffer Overflow') vulnerability in Secomea GateManager (webserver modules) allows crash of GateManager.This issue affects GateManager: from 9.7 before 11.2.624095033.

item.title: CVE-2024-1579|2024-06-04T17:59:30.225Z -- secomea -- gatemanager
item.description: Incorrect Usage of Seeds in Pseudo-Random Number Generator (PRNG) vulnerability in Secomea GateManager (Webserver modules) allows Session Hijacking.This issue affects GateManager: before 11.2.624071020.

item.title: CVE-2024-1969|2024-06-04T18:00:05.549Z -- secomea -- gatemanager
item.description: Buffer Copy without Checking Size of Input ('Classic Buffer Overflow') vulnerability in Secomea GateManager (webserver modules) allows crash of GateManager.This issue affects GateManager: from 9.7 before 11.2.624095033.

item.title: CVE-2023-3675|2024-04-18T10:41:32.348Z -- secomea -- gatemanager
item.description: Improper Limitation of a Pathname to a Restricted Directory ('Path Traversal') vulnerability in Secomea GateManager (Web GUI) allows Reading Data from System Resources.This issue affects GateManager: from 11.0.623074018 before 11.0.623373051.
